# smartphone addiction inventory (SPAI) The Smartphone Addiction Inventory (SPAI) was developed to assess smartphone addiction. \n The inventory contains 26 questions on a 4-point Likert scale. \n
You can click SUBMIT once all questions are responded to.\n \n Please select how much you agree or disagree with each question:\n 1 = strongly disagree 2 = somewhat disagree, 3 = somewhat agree and 4 = strongly agree \n
Smartphone Addiction Inventory (SPAI)
# sas sv
The Smartphone Addiction Scale can be used to identify potential high-risk groups for smartphone addiction. It contains ten 6-point Likert scale items.\n You can click SUBMIT once all questions are responded to.
Please select how much you agree or disagree with each question.\n 1 = strongly disagree 2 = disagree, 3 = weakly disagree, 4 = weakly agree, 5 = agree, 6 = strongly agree
Smartphone Addiction Scale-Short Version (SAS-SV)
# onboarding consent Do you consent to these terms?
This consent form part of the process of informed consent. It should give you the basic idea of what the research is about and what your participation will involve. If you would like more detail about something mentioned here, or information not included here, please ask. Please take the time to read this form carefully and to understand any accompanying information. This study investigates daily smartphone use, effectiveness of smartphone usage intervention methods, and the effect of smartphone usage on sleep quality. This study will last approximately 5-6 weeks with an optional extension. We will collect smartphone usage data from the screen sensor, logging times when smartphone screen is unlocked. You will be requested to answer questionnaires using this application. All collected data is stored anonymously using Google Firebase. You can access your own data from your smartphone. We will also request each participant to provide sleep quality data after the study period through the Fitbit API. This research is conducted by University of Oulu. The responsible researcher is Dr. Aku Visuri (aku.visuri@oulu.fi) In no way does this waive your legal rights nor release the investigators, sponsors, or involved institutions from their legal and professional responsibilities. You are free to not answer specific items or questions in interviews or on questionnaires. You are free to withdraw from the study at any time without penalty. Your continued participation should be as informed as your initial consent, so you should feel free to ask for clarification or new information throughout your participation. If you have further questions concerning matters related to this research, please contact the researcher. We retain the possibility to retract your participation in case of any technical difficulties emerge, and will inform you in case it happens.
# onboarding information This study consists of three phases. Before starting each phase, you will receive a notification and need to interact with this application to start that study phase.
The baseline phase lasts for 14 days, during which this application monitors your smartphone use through screen events; it tracks when the screen of your smartphone is ON, OFF, or in the UNLOCKED state. \n You will see the following persistent notification in your notification tray to indicate that the monitoring service is running
If you do not see this notification, it means the application has been automatically shut down. In this case, please restart this application manually from its launcher icon.
Before the first intervention phase (INT1), you will be asked how much you wish to reduce your daily smartphone usage, and what is your typical bedtime. \n During INT1, you will receive notifications that inform you about your daily smartphone use, and will receive a popup screen after unlocking your phone if you 1) have exceeded your daily goal or 2) close to your bedtime.\n This popup prompts you to either ignore it, or cease using your smartphone. The goal of INT1 is to serve as an initial prompt for helping you reduce your smartphone use.\n INT1 lasts for 7 days.
Before moving from INT1 to INT2, you will again be asked for verification.\n During INT2, you will no longer receive the popup after unlocking, but will still receive information about your smartphone usage. You will be expected to use this information to help you reduce your smartphone use, or keep it within your designated goal.\n INT2 lasts two weeks, after which this study concludes.\n After INT2 you will be asked to again fill the Smartphone Addiction Survey, and will be asked to answer a brief questionnaire about the study and the intervention mechanisms.\n Finally, you will receive the Prolific study completion code, if you require one.
